intro: Sindora kontumensis, commonly known as the Kontum sindora, is a rare and endemic species native to the tropical rainforests of Vietnam. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces elongated pods that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sindora kontumensis is considered a vulnerable species.
